00026 class Cylinder : public Quadric {
00027 public:
00028     Cylinder(const std::vector<double>& point, const std::vector<double>& axis,
00029              double radius)
00030         : _point(point), _axis(axis), _radius(radius) 
00031     {
00032         // we only live in 3-space
00033         Require( _point.size() == 3 );
00034         Require( _axis.size() == 3 );
00035         // require unit normal 
00036         Require(softEquiv(tranSupport::vectorNorm(_axis), 1.0));
00037     }
00038 
00039     Cylinder* clone() const { return new Cylinder(*this); }
00040 
00041     ~Cylinder() {   }
00042 
00043     bool hasPosSense(const std::vector<double>& position) const;
00044 
00045     HitAndDist intersect(const std::vector<double>& Position, 
00046             const std::vector<double>& Direction, bool PosSense) const;
00047 
00048 protected:
00050     std::ostream& _output( std::ostream& os ) const;
00051 
00052 private:
00053     const std::vector<double> _point;
00054     const std::vector<double> _axis;
00055     const double _radius;
00056 
00057 };
00058 
00059 // TODO: eliminate use of pow with integer coefficients
00060 // also having it work would be nice!
00061 
00062 // Equation: (X-P)^2 - [(X-P).U]^2 - R^2 = 0
00063 //      X = position 
00064 //      P = point on axis of cylinder
00065 //      U = direction vector of cylinder axis
00066 inline bool Cylinder::hasPosSense(const std::vector<double>& position) const
00067 {
00068     double eval(0);
00069 
00070     // Perform (X-P)^2
00071     double posMinusPoint(0);
00072     for( int i = 0; i < 3; ++i ){
00073         posMinusPoint += pow(position[i] - _point[0], 2);
00074     }
00075 
00076     // Perform [(X-P).U]^2
00077     for( int i = 0; i < 3; ++i ){
00078         eval += posMinusPoint - posMinusPoint*_axis[i];
00079     }
00080 
00081     eval -= _radius*_radius;
00082     
00083     return _hasPosSense(eval);
00084 }
00085 
00086 // This could be done more efficiently but this way is (arguably) closer to 
00087 // the original math.
00088 inline Quadric::HitAndDist Cylinder::intersect(
00089         const std::vector<double>& position, 
00090         const std::vector<double>& direction, bool posSense) const
00091 {
00092     Require(position.size() == 3);
00093     Require(direction.size() == 3);
00094     Require(softEquiv(tranSupport::vectorNorm(direction), 1.0));
00095 
00096     double A(0.0);   // 1-(direction._axis)^2
00097     for( int i = 0; i < 3; ++i ) {
00098         A += direction[i]*_axis[i];
00099     }
00100     A = 1-A*A;
00101 
00102     double B(0.0);                  // direction.{(position-_point)-
00103     double diff(0.0);               //_axis.[(position-_point)._axis]}
00104     for( int i = 0; i < 3; ++i ) {   
00105         diff = position[i] - _point[i];
00106         B += direction[i]*(diff - pow(_axis[i],2)*diff);
00107     }
00108 
00109     double C(0.0);                  // (position - _point)^2 - 
00110     diff = 0.0;
00111     for( int i = 0; i < 3; ++i ){   // [(position-_point)._axis]^2-_radius^2
00112         C += position[i]*_point[i];
00113         diff += pow( (position[i]*_point[i]*_axis[i]) , 2);
00114     }
00115 
00116     C -= (diff + _radius * _radius );
00117 
00118     return _calcQuadraticIntersect(A, B, C, posSense);
00119 }
00120 
00121 inline std::ostream& Cylinder::_output( std::ostream& os ) const {
00122     os  << "[ CYL   Point:  " << std::setw(10) << _point
00123         << " Axis: " << std::setw(10) << _axis 
00124         << " Radius: " << std::setw(5) << _radius << " ]";
00125     return os;
00126 }
